materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Red (39729) 3 balls
Contrast B Soft Green (39739) 2 balls
Contrast C White (39701) 2 balls
Contrast D Cool Green (39770) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 25" [63.5 cm] deep.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
With A, ch 55.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 1 hdc). 1 hdc in each of next 4 ch. *2 hdc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 5 ch. Rep from * to end of ch. Turn. 61 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 5 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 5 hdc. Turn. 69 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 77 hdc.
4th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 5 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 5 hdc. Turn. 85 hdc.
Cont as established, inc 8 hdc every row until there are 245 hdc, ending on a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Working in front loops only , sl st in each of next 2 hdc. *Skip next 4 hdc. 10 tr in next hdc. Skip next 4 hdc. Sl st in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. Sl st in each of next 3 hdc. Fasten off.
With RS facing, join B with sl st to rem loop of first hdc. Ch 2. Working in rem loops of last row , work 14 rows as before, inc 8 hdc every row until there are 357 hdc, ending on a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Working in front loops only, sl st in next hdc. *Skip next 4 hdc. 10 tr in next hdc. Skip next 4 hdc. Sl st in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. Sl st in last hdc. Fasten off.
With RS facing, join C with sl st to rem loop of first hdc. Ch 2. Working in rem loops of last row , work 14 rows as before, inc 8 hdc every row until there are 469 hdc, ending on a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Working in front loops only , sl st in each of next 2 hdc. *Skip next 4 hdc. 10 tr in next hdc. Skip next 4 hdc. Sl st in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. Sl st in each of next 2 hdc. Fasten off.
With RS facing, join D with sl st to rem loop of first hdc. Ch 2. Working in rem loops of last row , work 14 rows as before, inc 8 hdc every row until there are 581 hdc, ending on a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Working in front loops only, sl st in next hdc. *Skip next 4 hdc. 10 tr in next hdc. Skip next 4 hdc. Sl st in next hdc. Rep from * to end. Fasten off.

materials: 2 skeins 316 Soft White B
1 skein each 319 Cherry Red A
512 Turqua C
706 Perfect Pink D
672 Spring Green E
718 Shocking Pink F
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
pompom maker or 3" (7.5 cm) piece of heavy cardboard
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Skirt measures 50" (127 cm) in diameter.
gauge: 12 sts = 4" (10 cm); 8 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 53.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch do not count as a st), dc in next 4 ch, *ch 2, dc in next 5 ch; repeat from * across; change to B, turn—50 dc and 9 ch-2 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), *hdc in each st across to next ch-2 space, (hdc, ch 2, hdc) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * 8 times, hdc in each remaining st; change to C, turn—68 hdc and 9 ch-2 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 3 (does not count as a st), *dc in each st across to next ch-2 space, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * 8 times, dc in each remaining st; change to B, turn—86 dc and 9 ch-2 spaces.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2; change to D.
Rows 5–40: Repeat last 2 rows 18 times, changing color in the following color sequence: Work *1 row with D, 1 row with B, 1 row with E, 1 row with B, 1 row with F, 1 row with B, 1 row with A, 1 row with B, 1 row with C, 1 row with B; repeat from * twice, 1 row with D, 1 row with B, 1 row with E, 1 row with B, 1 row with F, 1 row with B.
Fasten off.
Border Row: With right side facing and working in ends of rows, join A with sc in Row 1, 2 sc in same row, 3 sc in each odd-numbered row; working in last row, 3 sc in first st, *dc in each st across to next ch-2 space, (dc, ch 2, dc) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * 8 times, dc in each st across to last st, 3 sc in last st; working in ends of rows, 3 sc in each odd-numbered row; join with slip st in first st of Row 1. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Pompoms
With A, following pompom maker directions, make nine 3" (7.5 cm) pompoms or make pompoms as follows: Wrap yarn around 3" (7.5 cm) piece of heavy cardboard (the more wraps, the fuller the pompom). Gently remove wraps from cardboard. Cut a 12" (30.5 cm) length of A and tie it tightly around center of wraps. Do not cut the ends of this center tie. Cut ends of wraps. Fluff and trim pompom. Use ends of center tie to attach pompoms. Tie one pompom to each ch-2 space. Weave in ends.

pattern_name: Bells, Flakes and Tree Skirt Edging
materials: Patons Grace (50 g/1.75 oz) - 1 ball will make 10 snowflakes.
1 ball will make 5 clusters of 3 bells.
5 balls will make edging to measure 156 ins [396 cm].
Size 3.25 mm (U.S. 3) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
Crochet thread stiffener.
Pearl beads for Bells.
Any size fabric tree skirt, purchased or home-sewn.
measurements: Sizes: Snowflake: Approx 3 ins [7.5 cm] wide. Bell: Approx 2½ x 2 ins [6 x 5 cm]. Tree Skirt Edging: Approx 4 ins [10 cm] wide.
instructions:
SNOWFLAKE A
Ch 8. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in ring. Ch 12. (3 dc in ring. Ch 12) 5 times. Join with sl st in top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: 1 ss in each of next 2 dc. 1 sl st in each of next 5 ch of ch 12. (Ch 3. 2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) all in same ch-12 sp. *Ch 7. Miss next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) all in next ch-12 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Ch 7. Miss next 3 dc. Join with sl st in top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: 1 ss in each of next 2 dc. 1 sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. [2 dc. (Ch 5. Ss in first ch) 3 times. Sl st in top of last dc - triple picot made. 3 dc] all in same ch 3 sp. *[(Ch 3. 1 sc) twice. Ch 4. (1 sc. Ch 3) twice] all in next ch-7 sp**. (3 dc. Triple picot. 3 dc) all in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * 4 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st in top of ch 3. Fasten off.

SNOWFLAKE B
Ch 8. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in ring. Ch 2) 12 times. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: (1 sl st. Ch 2. 1 dc) all in first ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next ch 2 sp. *Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook*. Yoh and draw up a loop in same ch-2 sp. Rep from * to * once more. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - cluster made. (Ch 3) 11 times. Join with sl st in top of ch 2.
3rd rnd: (1 sl st. Ch 1. 2 sc) all in first ch-3 sp. (Ch 5. 2 sc in next ch-3 sp) 11 times. Ch 2. 1 dc in first sc.
4th rnd: *Ch 4. [1 tr. (Ch 1. 1 tr) 3 times] all in next ch-5 sp. Ch 4**. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * 4 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st in first dc.
5th rnd: (1 sl st. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in first ch of ch-4 sp. Ch 3. Sl st in first ch - picot 3 made. 1 sc in same ch-4 sp. *[(1 sc. Picot 3. 1 sc) all in next tr. Miss next ch-1 sp] twice. Ch 5. Sl st in first ch - picot 5 made. [Miss next ch-1 sp. (1 sc. Picot 3. 1 sc) all in next tr] twice. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Picot 3. 1 sc in same ch-4 sp**. (1 sc. Picot 3. 1 sc) all in next ch-4 sp. Rep from * 4 times more, then from * to ** once more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

SNOWFLAKE C
Ch 5. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3). (1 dc in ring. Ch 3) 11 times. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch 6.

ABBREVIATIONS: www.patonsyarns.com/glossary

BELLS, FLAKES AND TREE SKIRT EDGING
2nd rnd: Sl st in ch 3 sp. Ch 1. [(1 sc. Ch 7. 1 sc) all in ch-3 sp. 2 sc in next ch-3 sp] 6 times. Join with sl st in first sl st.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. [Miss next sc. (2 sc. Ch 2. 3 dc. 2 tr. Ch 4. Sl st in first ch - picot 4 made. 1 tr. 3 dc. Ch 2. 2 sc) all in next ch-7 sp. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc] 6 times. Join with sl st in first sc.
4th rnd: *Sl st in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. Sl st in first ch - picot 3 made. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Picot 3. 1 sc in next tr. Miss next tr. (3 sc. Picot 4. 2 sc) all in next picot sp. 1 sc in next tr. Picot 3. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Picot 3. 1 sc in next dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Sl st in each of next 3 sc. Picot 3. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * 5 times more. Fasten off.
FINISHING 
Saturate snowflakes in crochet thread stiffener, stretch and pin flat to plastic wrap covered surface. Attach twisted cord as hanger.
Twisted Cord: Cut 1 strand of yarn 10 ins [25 cm] long. Hold 1 end and twist other end to the right until strand begins to curl. Fold the 2 ends tog and tie in a knot so it will not unravel. The strands will now twist themselves tog. Adjust length if desired.

BELL (make 3 for each cluster).
Ch 4. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
4th to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
8th rnd: As 4th rnd.
9th rnd: As 7th rnd. 25 sc.
10th rnd: As 4th rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 sc in each sc around for reverse sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING 
Make 1 twisted cord for each Bell as given for Snowflakes. Attach bead to end of cord. Thread rem end of cord through top of Bell. Tie 3 cords tog securely at top of cluster, then tie again at end to form loop. Adjust length if desired.

TREE SKIRT EDGING
Ch 6.
Foundation row: (WS). 1 tr in 6th ch from hook. *Ch 5. 1 tr in top of tr. Rep from * for desired length to fit around outer edge of tree skirt. Turn.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in tr *. Ch 5. (1 sc. Ch 3. Sl st in first ch - picot made. 1 sc) all in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * to end of row. Ch 2. 1 dc in first ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 5. (1 sc. Picot. 1 sc) all in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 5. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: *Ch 5. (1 sc. Picot. 1 sc) all in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 2. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 6. (1 sc. Picot. 1 sc) all in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 6. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: *Ch 6. (1 sc. Picot. 1 sc) all in next ch-6-sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 3. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 7. (1 sc. Picot. 1 sc) all in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 7. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
7th row: *Ch 7. (1 sc. Picot. 1 sc) all in next ch-7 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 3. 1 tr in last sc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first tr. *Ch 8. 1 sc in next ch-7 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 8. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. *(6 sc. Picot. 6 sc) all in next ch-8 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Place Edging onto flat surface to form a circle. Cover with a damp pressing cloth and apply a hot iron. Remove when dry. Machine or hand stitch to Tree Skirt.

materials: Bernat® Happy Holidays™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 240 yds/vgs/219 m)
Main Color (MC) Glittery Green (31711) 1 ball
Contrast A Twinkly White (31709) Approx 10 yds/9 m
Sizes U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) and U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Beg Tr5tog = Ch 5. [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook twice)] 4 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – counts as 1 stitch.
Dtr = (Yoh) 3 times and draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times
measurements: Approx 18" [45.5 cm] circumference at base x 10" [25.5 cm] tall, excluding star.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
TREE
Note: Tree is worked sideways.
With larger hook and MC, ch 37.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 9 ch. 1 dc in each of next 9 ch. 1 tr in each of next 8 ch. (4 tr. 1 dtr) in last ch. 40 sts. Turn. From this point on, work all sts into front loop only.
2nd row: Beg Tr5tog. 1 tr in each of next 8 tr. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 1 sl st in each of next 4 sc. 36 sts. One Wedge made. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. 1 tr in each of next 8 tr. (4 tr. 1 dtr) in last tr. 40 sts. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row. Rep last 2 rows 7 times more. 9 Wedges. Fasten off.
Ridges: With RS facing and beg at bottom (wider edge) of Tree, join MC with sl st to rem back loop at center of any Wedge. Ch 1. 1 sc in each rem back loop to end of row. Fasten off. Rep for each Wedge around.
Sew foundation ch and last row of Tree tog. Thread yarn through sts at top of Tree, catching last st of each Ridge row and cinch tightly.
Star: With smaller hook and A, ch 4.
1st rnd: 9 dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch-3 counts as dc). Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 10 dc.
2nd rnd: *Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in next ch. Skip next dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * around. Fasten off.
Sew Star to top of Tree.

pattern_name: Dip Your Toe Crochet Plant Cozies
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Gold (0321) 1 ball
Contrast B Aruba Sea (0505) 1 ball
Contrast C Medium Purple (0528) 1 ball
Contrast D Aran (0313) 1 ball
Contrast E Spring Green (0672) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit 5½" [14 cm] plant pot: Bottom Diameter: 4½" [11.5 cm] Top Diameter: 6¼" [16 cm]
instructions:
Version 1: A as Color 1 and B as Color 2.
Version 2: C as Color 1 and D as Color 2.
Version 3: B as Color 1 and E as Color 2.
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
12th to 18th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
19th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Break Color 1. Join Color 2. 66 sc.
20th rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
21st to 26th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
27th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.
28th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 28th rnd until work from 10th rnd measures 6" [15 cm].
Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m; Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m)
Contrast A Red (00095) 1 ball or 61 yds/56 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 25 yds/23.5 m
Contrast A Psychedelic Ombre (02600) 1 ball or 61 yds/56 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 25 yds/23.5 m
Contrast A Hot Blue (01742) 1 ball or 61 yds/56 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 25 yds/23.5 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Glue on googly eyes in assorted sizes
Small amount of black yarn for embroidery
Hot glue gun and glue sticks
Susan Bates® steel yarn needle
measurements: To fit standard 4½" [11 cm] diameter plant pot
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
BASE
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 48 sc.
SIDE
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until side measures 3" [7.5 cm] from bottom. Break A, join B.
With B, cont even until side measures 6" [15 cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Using hot glue gun, attach eyes to front. Using black yarn, embroider your favorite funny facial expression!

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Cat Pot Pal Soft Violet (00093) 1 ball or 71 yds/65 m
Bunny Pot Pal Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 66 yds/60 m
Bear Pot Pal Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball or 64 yds/58 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit standard 4½" [11 cm] diameter plant pot.
instructions:
BASE
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
SIDE
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Side measures approx 4" [10 cm] from bottom. Fasten off.
Bear Ears (make 2)
Ch 4.
1st row: 7 dc in 4th ch from hook. 8 dc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *2 sc in next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 2 sc in last dc. Fasten off.
Cat Ears (make 2)
Ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Do not turn.
Edging: Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around 3 edges, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Bunny Ears (make 2)
Ch 14. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc.
2nd to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st. 10 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st. 6 sts.
11th rnd: As 8th rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Join with sl st to first st. 3 sts.
13th rnd: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
All Versions: FINISHING Sew Ears to top edge of Pot as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart® All in One™ Flower Power™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m) Flower Field (2014) 1 ball (3 Motifs, tassel and hanging ties)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Piece of cardboard 5" [12.5 cm] wide for tassel.
measurements: To fit around 6" [15 cm] diameter plant pot.
gauge:
12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]
Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions:
Notes:
• Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in.
• 2nd and 3rd rnds will be worked in Color 2.
• 4th, 5th, and 6th rnds will be worked in Color 3.
• If too much color is left at end of 1st rnd (Color 1) or 3rd rnd (Color 2), pull back some sts and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change.
• At end of final rnd, Motif should measure 6" [15 cm] square, with long tail (at least 24" [61 cm]) rem for seaming.
• Adjust gauge as needed while working 4th, 5th and 6th rounds to maintain 6" [15 cm] square finished size.
MOTIF (make 3)
See diagram on page 3.
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st unless otherwise stated.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 9 dc in ring. Join. 10 dc. Color 1 complete.
2nd rnd: Color 2 begins. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join. 20 dc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next dc. (Ch 3. 1 tr) in same st as last sl st. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. *(1 dc. 1 tr) in next dc. 3 tr in next dc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in next dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * around, ending by joining with sl st to top of ch-3 of previous (2nd) rnd. Color 2 complete.
4th rnd: Color 3 begins. Sl st in first dc (top of ch-3 of 3rd rnd), to beg rnd at start of first Petal. Ch 3. *1 dc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 sc in next tr. 1 hdc in next tr. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. 1 tr in dc of 2nd rnd (below sl st). **1 dc in next dc. Rep from * 3 times more, then from * to ** once. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 6 (counts as tr and ch-2). 1 tr in same sp as sl st. *2 dc in next st. Ch 1. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Ch 1. 2 dc in next st. **(1 tr. Ch 2. 1 tr) all in next st. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join to 4th ch of ch-6.
6th rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 3 hdc in same ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(3 hdc. Ch 1) in each ch-1 sp to next corner ch-2 sp. **(3 hdc. Ch 3. 3 hdc) all in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 hdc in first ch-2 sp. Join. Fasten off at end of Color 3, leaving long tail for seaming. Motif should measure 6" [15 cm] square.
Tassel
Cut a piece of cardboard 5" [12.5 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 30 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops 2" [5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly.
ASSEMBLY
Hanging Straps.
With Color 3, ch 48.
Cont working across edge of 2 Motifs to join as follows:
Seaming with Flat Sl St Join: (RS). Sl st 2 Motifs tog, ensuring Motifs are oriented the same direction, working through back loops only and keeping working yarn to WS of work to create a flat sl st chain detail on RS of work (see diagram).
FLAT SL ST JOIN
Note: Keep working yarn to WS of work so only flat sl st chain is visible on RS.
Ch 10. Fasten off leaving long tail.
Rep above steps twice more with rem Motifs to create tube of Motifs.
Insert 6" [15 cm] plant pot into center of tube of Motifs, with ch-10 at bottom of Plant Pot. Tie 3 lengths of ch-10 lengths tog in an overhand knot where they meet at center of Plant Pot base. Tie Tassel to ends of ch-10 using long tails. Bring 3 lengths of ch-48 to meet above Plant Pot so all 3 lengths are pulled tight. Tie tops of ch-48 tog to create hanging loop. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 726 Coral A, 505 Aruba Sea B, 668 Honeydew C, and 320 Cornmeal D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [H-8 US]
Yarn needle
0.71 gal. nursery container, 4¾” bottom diameter x 7” tall x 6½” top diameter (12 x 18 x 16.5 cm) (available at Home Depot)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cozy measures 5 ¼” bottom diameter x 7 ¼” tall (13.5 x 18.5 cm)
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm) in pattern; 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Beginning at bottom, with A, ch 3; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): With A, ch 1, [2 sc in ring; change to B, 2 sc in ring; change to A] twice; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Round 2: With A, ch 1, [2 sc in next 2 sts; change to B, 2 sc in next 2 sts; change to A] twice; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Round 3: With A, ch 1, *[2 sc in next st, sc in next st] twice; change to B, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] twice; change to A; repeat from * once; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 4: With A, ch 1, *[2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] twice; change to B, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] twice; change to A; repeat from * once; join with slip st in first sc—32 sc.
Round 5: With A, ch 1, *[2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] twice; change to B, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] twice; change to A; repeat from * once; join with slip st in first sc—40 sc.
Round 6: With A, ch 1, *[2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] twice; change to B, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] twice; change to A; repeat from * once; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
Round 7: With A, ch 1, *[2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] twice; change to B, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] twice; change to A; repeat from * once; join with slip st in first sc—56 sc.
Round 8: With A, ch 1, *[2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] twice; change to B, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] twice; change to A; repeat from * once; join with slip st in first sc—64 sc.
Round 9: With A, carrying B on wrong side, and working in back loops only, ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 11–14: With A, ch 1, sc in next 2 sts; change to B, [sc in next 4 sts; change to A, sc in next 4 sts; change to B] 7 times, sc in next 4 sts; change to A, sc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 15: Repeat Round 10.
Rounds 16–19: With A, ch 1, sc in next 3 sts; change to C, [sc in next 4 sts; change to A, sc in next 4 sts; change to C] 7 times, sc in next 4 sts; change to A, sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 20: With A, Repeat Round 10.
Round 21: With A, ch 1, sc in next 4 sts; change to D, *sc in next 3 sts; change to A, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts; change to D, [sc in next 3 sts; change to A, sc in next 8 sts; change to D] twice; repeat from * to * once, sc in next 3 sts; change to A, sc in last 4 sts; join with slip st in first sc—66 sc.
Round 22: With A, ch 1, sc in next 3 sts; change to D, [sc in next 5 sts; change to A, sc in next 6 sts; change to D] 5 times, sc in next 5 sts; change to A, sc in last 3 sts; join with slip st in first st.
Round 23: With A, ch 1, sc in next 3 sts; change to D, [sc in next 2 sts; change to A, sc in next st; change to D, sc in next 3 sts; change to A, sc in next 5 sts; change to D] 5 times, sc in next 2 sts; change to A, sc in next st; change to D, sc in next 3 sts; change to A, sc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in first st.
Round 24: With A, ch 1, sc in next 3 sts; change to D, [sc in next 6 sts; change to A, sc in next 5 sts; change to D] 5 times, sc in next 6 sts; change to A, sc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in first st.
Round 25: With A, ch 1, sc in next 4 sts; change to D, [sc in next 4 sts; change to A, sc in next 7 sts; change to D] 5 times, sc in next 4 sts; change to A, sc in last 3 sts; join with slip st in first st.
Round 26: With A, repeat Round 10.
Round 27: With C, repeat Round 10.
Round 28: With A, repeat Round 10.
Round 29: With B, repeat Round 10.
Rounds 30 and 31: Repeat Rounds 28 and 29.
Round 32: With A, repeat Round 10.
Round 33: With A, ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 16 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 15 sts] twice; join with slip st in first sc—70 sts.
Round 34: With A, ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 17 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 16 sts] twice; join with slip st in first sc—74 sts. Cut B.
Edging 
Round 35: With A, ch 3, bobble over first 2 sts, *bobble over next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Fasten off.
Optional Open Bottom
With A, ch 65.
Round 1: With A and working over B, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch around; join with slip st to first sc—64 sc.
Continue working same as Rounds 10–35. Weave in beginning tail to join lower edge of Round 1.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Insert container.

materials: RED HEART® Vivid™: 2 balls 6804 Electric Blue
Susan Bates ® Crochet Hook: 11.50mm [US P-16]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Size: 20” (50.8 cm) in circumference; 9” (22.9 cm) tall
gauge: 6 post stitches and 5 rounds = 4” (10cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PLANT COZY
Ch 4, join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, 10 sc in ring, join with slip st in beginning sc, fasten off—10 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, 2 sc in each st around, join with slip st in beginning sc—20 sc.
Round 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in same st as beginning ch-3, dc in next st, *2 dc in next st, dc in next st; repeat from * around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—30 dc.
Round 4: Ch 2 (does not count as st), FPdc around first st, FPdc around next 4 sts, BPdc around next 5 sts, *FPdc around next 5 sts, BPdc around next 5 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in top of first FPdc—15 FPdc, 15 BPdc.
Round 5: Ch 2, BPdc around first st, BPdc around next 4 sts, FPdc around next next 5 sts, *BPdc around next 5 sts, FPdc around next 5 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in top of first BPdc.
Rounds 6–11: Repeat rounds 4–5 three times. Fasten off after last round.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Maker Minis™ Kit Includes: 10 balls (1.7 oz/50 g each; 17.6 oz/500 g total), (61yds/ 56m each; 610 yds/560 m total)
White 1 ball or 61 yds/56 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
1 pair of 8 mm Safety Eyes.
Small length of Red for Mouth.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 3½" [9 cm] tall (excluding Legs).
instructions: Note: Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. Move marker onto first st at beg of each rnd. Ch 3. See diagrams on page 2. 1st rnd: 8 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 2nd rnd: 2 hdc in each hdc around. 16 hdc. 3rd rnd: *2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 24 hdc. 4th rnd: *2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. 32 hdc. Make sides: 5th rnd: Working through back loop and horizontal bar at back of each st, 1 hdc in each hdc around. 6th rnd: 1 hdc in each hdc around. Rep last rnd until work from 5th rnd measures 3½" [9 cm]. Sl st in next hdc. Fasten off. Arms (Make 2) Ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 3rd rnd: 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 4th rnd: 1 sc in each st around. 5th to 8th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off at end of 8th rnd. Legs (Make 2) Ch 2. 1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 2nd and 3rd rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 4th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. 6 sts. 5th to 8th rnds: 1 sc in each st around. Fasten off at end of last rnd. ‘Stuff’ feet with small amount of yarn. FINISHING Sew Arms to either side of Cozy. Sew Legs to front. Following manufacturer’s instructions, insert Safety eyes, approx 4 rows down from top edge, spaced 5 sc apart. With small length of Red, embroider mouth with straight stitch evenly between Eyes, 1 row below.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Holidays Twists (80 g/2.8 oz; 138 yds/ 126m) MC: #45708 (Yuletide Twists) 14 balls
Bernat® Handicrafter® Holidays Sparkle (80 g/2.8 oz; 138 yds/ 126m) A: #48705 (Red Sparkle) 4 balls
Size 5.5 mm (U.S. I or 9) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 62 ins [157 cm] across.
instructions:
Stripe Pat
2 rows A. 2 rows MC. 8 rows A. 
2 rows MC. 2 rows A. 1 row MC.
Panel: (make 8). With A, ch 66 loosely.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 65 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across, joining MC at end of row. Turn. First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, proceed as follows: 
3rd row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made. 
1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn. 
4th and 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
Rep last 3 rows to 55 sts. Break A.
Cont with MC only, dec 1 st each end of next and every following 4th row to 13 sts. Fasten off.
Sew panels tog in a circle, leaving one side open.
Edging: With RS of work facing, join A with sl st to side edge at top. Ch 1. Work in sc evenly down side edge, around outer edge, and up other side edge, having 3 sc in corners. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 334 Buff A, 322 Pale Yellow B, 256 Carrot C, 319 Cherry Red D, 378 Claret E, 358 Lavender F, 886 Blue G, 656 Real Teal H, 672 Spring Green I, 389 Hunter Green J.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5].
Yarn needle, stitch marker.
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E, … = Color A, B, C, D, E …
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
() = work directions in parentheses into same stitch.
measurements: Skirt measures 58” diameter, to fit around standard tree holder.
gauge: 12 sts = 4”; 6 rows = 4” in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2012 Coats & Clark
Granny Tree  
Skirt
Create a tree skirt that reflects your passion 
for crochet and the beloved granny square 
motif! This skirt is shown in a scrappy look, 
using ten different colors of yarn. Each of 
the grannies has more stitches on the outer 
edge so it will lie flat. Start early and crochet 
a couple squares a month and you’ll have it 
done in time to trim the tree! 
Row 5: With Right Side facing, draw up a loop
of F in first dc, ch 3, 3 dc in first ch-1 space,
[ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] 4 times, ch 1,
(3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-1 space (increase
made), [ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] 8 times,
ch 1, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-1 space,
*[ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] 7 times, ch
1, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-1 space, [ch 1,
3 dc in next ch-1 space] 8 times, ch 1, (3 dc,
ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from *
once more, [ch 1, 3 dc in ch-1 space] 5 times,
3 dc in turning ch-space, dc in 3rd ch of
beginning ch—Sixty-one 3-dc groups and 60
ch-1 spaces. Fasten off F.
Row 6: With Wrong Side facing, draw up a
loop of I in the space between the first 2 dc,
ch 4, 3 dc in next ch-1 space, [ch 1, 3 dc in
next ch-1 space] 9 times, ch 1, (3 dc, ch 1,
3 dc) in next ch-1 space, *[ch 1, 3 dc in next
ch-1 space] 18 times, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next
ch-1 space; repeat from * once more, [ch 1, 3
dc in next ch-1 space] 11 times, dc in space
between last dc and beginning ch—Sixty-
three 3-dc groups and 64 ch-1 spaces. Fasten
off I.
Row 7: With Right Side facing, draw up a
loop of D in first dc, ch 3, 3 dc in first ch-1
space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] 5
times, ch 1, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-1
space (increase made), [ch 1, 3 dc in next
ch-1 space] 10 times, ch 1, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc)
in next ch-1 space, *[ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1
space] 8 times, ch 1, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next
ch-1 space, [ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space]
10 times, ch 1, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-1
space; repeat from * once more, [ch 1, 3 dc in
ch-1 space] 5 times, 3 dc in turning ch-space,
dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch—Seventy 3-dc
groups and 69 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off D.

INNER RING
With B, ch 140.
Row 1 (Right Side): 3 dc in 4th ch from hook 
(beginning ch counts as first dc), *skip next 
2 ch, 3 dc in next ch; repeat from * across to 
last ch, dc in last ch—Forty-six 3-dc groups, 
and one dc on each end. Fasten off B.
Row 2: With Wrong Side facing, draw up a 
loop of G in the space between the first 2 dc, 
ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1 here and throughout), 
*3 dc in next space between 3-dc groups, ch
1; repeat from * across, dc in space between 
last dc and beginning ch—Forty-five 3-dc 
groups, 46 ch-1 spaces, and one dc on each 
end. Fasten off G.
Row 3: With Right Side facing, draw up a loop 
of C in first dc, ch 3, 3 dc in first ch-1 space, 
[ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] 4 times, ch 1, 
(3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-1 space (increase 
made), *[ch 1, 3 dc in next ch-1 space] 6 
times, ch 1, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-1 
space; repeat from * 4 more times, [ch 1, 3 
dc in ch-1 space] 4 times, 3 dc in turning ch-
space, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch—Fifty-two 
3-dc groups and 51 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off C.
Row 4: With Wrong Side facing, draw up a
loop of A in the space between the first 2 dc,
ch 4, 3 dc in next ch-1 space, [ch 1, 3 dc in
next ch-1 space] 8 times, ch 1, (3 dc, ch 1,
3 dc) in next ch-1 space, *[ch 1, 3 dc in next
ch-1 space] 15 times, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next

Rounds 5-10: Repeat Round 4 six times and
continue to change color every round as in
color sequence—4 corners and eight 3-dc
groups on each side at the end of Round 10.

FINISHING
Arrange granny squares around outer edge 
of inner ring, as shown in Assembly Diagram. 
Take care to place shorter (marked) edge of 
each granny square next to edge of inner ring. 
Match the ten 3-dc groups across the top 
edge of each granny square with eight 3-dc 
groups (and the ch-1 spaces between the 
3-dc groups) of outer edge of inner ring. Sew
the granny squares together and to the inner 
ring. The designer recommends sewing the 
squares together in groups of three and then 
sewing the group of three to the inner ring.

Outer Border
Row 1 (Right Side): With Right Side facing, 
join D in outer corner of ring of granny 
squares, to work across outer edge, ch 2, 
work 1 hdc in each dc, 1 hdc in each ch-1 
space, and 2 hdc in each corner ch-2 space 
(where squares are joined) all the way across 
outer edge. Fasten off.
Row 2 (Right Side): With Right Side facing, 
join E in top of beginning ch-2 of Row 1, ch 1, 
working in back loops only slip st in each hdc 
across. Note: Work with relaxed tension so as 
not to pull in the outer edge. Fasten off.
Inner Border 
Row 1 (Right Side): With Right Side facing, 
join D in inner corner of inner ring, to work 
across inner edge, ch 2, 2 hdc in each space 
between 3-dc groups all the way across inner 
edge, DO NOT TURN.
Row 2: Working in the opposite direction 
(without turning piece, to work reverse hdc 
sts), ch 2, work hdc in each space between 
2-dc groups across, slip st in beginning ch-2
of Row 1.
Fasten off.
Side Borders
Row 1 (Right Side): With Right Side facing, 
join D in corner, to work across side edge, 
hdc evenly spaced across side edge, DO NOT 
TURN.
Row 2: Ch 1, reverse sc in each st across.
Fasten off. Repeat across other side edge.
Weave in any remaining ends. Lay skirt flat on 
floor around tree holder, and pat into position. 
Note any areas that may need blocking. Block 
piece very, very lightly, if needed.

materials: Peaches & Crème® Cone (14 oz/400 g; 674 yds/616 m)
Panorama (01100) 1 cone or 425 yds/388.5 m
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Stitch marker
Wooden ring approx 2" (5 cm) in diameter
6 wooden beads approx ½" (1.5 cm) diameter
abbreviations: Beglnkdc = Insert hook down through horizontal bar in center of previous stitch, yoh and pull up a loop. Insert hook into ring, yoh and pull up a loop. Yoh and pull through first 2 loops on hook. Yoh and pull through last 2 loops on hook – Beginning Linked Dc made.

Lnkdc = Insert hook down through the horizontal bar in the center of previous stitch, yoh and pull up a loop. Insert hook in indicated space or stitch and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through first 2 loops on hook. Yoh and pull through last 2 loops on hook – Linked Dc made.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 3½" x 8" [9 x 20.5 cm].
instructions:
Notes: Rnds are worked as a spiral. First lnkdc of each rnd is worked into last lnkdc of previous rnd. 
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
Set-up rnd: (1 sc. 1 hdc. 1 dc. Place marker in dc. 8 beglnkdc) in ring. 1 lnkdc in each st to marker. 10 sts. 
1st rnd: (RS). Beg in first dc from previous rnd, work 2 lnkdc in each st around. 20 lnkdc.
2nd rnd: *1 lnkdc in next lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 30 lnkdc. 
3rd rnd: *1 lnkdc in each of next 2 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 40 lnkdc.
4th rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 lnkdc in each st around.
5th rnd: 1 lnkdc in each st around.
Rep 5th rnd until work from 4th rnd measures 4½" [11.5 cm]. 
Next rnd: 1 lnkdc in each lnkdc to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in next lnkdc. 1 sc in each of next 2 lnkdc. Join with sl st to first st in rnd. 
Shape Sides
Begin working in rows as follows:
**1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 10 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 8 sts.
5th to 8th rows: Rep 3rd and 4th rows twice more. 4 sts. 
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sts.
11th row: Ch 4. Join with sl st to next st. Fasten off.**
Join yarn with sl st to last rnd of lnkdc, leaving 8 sts between sl st and last st worked in first row of side shaping.  Work from ** to ** as given above.
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st on upper edge of Plant Hanger.  Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around edge, working 5 sc in each ch-4 sp. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1.  Working in back loops only, work 1 sc in each st around.  Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Fringe
Cut strands of yarn 16" [40.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands held tog, fold in half and knot into fringe along top of Plant Hanger as follows: use unworked front loops from last rnd of sc, work fringe into each of 6 sts on either side of ch-4 sps. Trim fringe evenly.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.
Hangers
Cut 12 lengths of yarn 18” [45.5 cm]. Holding 6 strands tog, thread through ch-4 sp at side of Plant Hanger, and fold in half so that ends meet.  Thread all strands through a wooden bead; push bead to base of strands.  Braid strands tog, with 4 strands held tog in each section of braid, until braid measures approx 5” [12.5 cm]. Thread all strands through another wooden bead to finish braid, ensuring bead is seated at top of braid. With 6 strands held on each side, wrap hanger strands around wooden ring. Thread all strands through another bead, and secure with a knot.  Trim evenly. Rep for opposite side of Plant Hanger.
Tassels (make 2).
Cut a piece of cardboard 5" [12.5 cm] wide. Wind yarn around cardboard 60 times. Break yarn leaving a long end and thread end through needle. Slip needle through all loops and tie tightly. Remove cardboard and wind yarn tightly around loops 1" [2.5 cm] below fold. Fasten securely. Cut through rem loops and trim ends evenly. Sew 1 Tassel to base of Plant Hanger and sew 1 Tassel to center front of Plant Hanger as shown in photo.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball White
Susan Bates® Steel Crochet Hook: 1.50 mm [US 7]
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
Two 20 x 30 sheets of foam board
one 8⅞ x 3⅞" (22.5 x 10 cm) StyrofoamTM cone with plastic wrapping still on
duct tape
rust-proof straight pins
self-sticking plastic wrap
fabric stiffener (see notes for using Epsom® salts for fabric stiffener)
craft glue
yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Tree Topper measures 10" (25.5 cm) across and 13½" (34.5 cm) in height
gauge: Rounds 1 and 2 of Main Body Motif = 2" (5 cm) across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
MAIN BODY MOTIF (make 3)
Ch 4, and slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Beg cl in ring, ch 5, [cl in ring, ch 5] 5 times, join with slip st in first cl.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as 1 dc), 7 dc in next ch-5 space, [dc in next cl, 7 dc in next ch-5 space] 5 times, join with slip st in first dc – 48 dc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each of first 5 dc, mark last sc made, * [ch 3, chwp, ch 1, chwp] twice (first half of spire stem completed), ch 12, slip st in 9th ch from hook to form ring, rotate work so you are ready to work into ring just formed as if it were a foundation ring, ch 1, (sc, 3 dc, dcwp in ring), [(4 dc, dcwp) in ring] twice, (3 dc, sc, slip st) in ring (spire head completed), working down the back side of first half of spire stem, ch 1, skip 1 ch, slip st in next ch, [ch 1, chwp, ch 1, chwp, ch 1, skip next 5 ch (both with and without picots), slip st in next ch] twice, ch 1, slip st in same dc as marked sc (second half of spire stem completed), remove marker, ** sc in each of next 8 dc, mark last sc made; repeat from * 5 more times, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of last 3 dc, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in each of first 2 sc, * ch 4, dc in ch space between first pair of picots on first half of spire stem, ch 6, tr in ch space between next pair of picots, (ch 7, tr, ch 3, tr) in each of 3 picots on spire head, ch 7, tr in ch space between first pair of picots on second half of spire stem, ch 6, dc in ch space between next pair of picots, ch 4, sk next 2 sc, ** sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * 5 more times, ending last repeat at **, sc in last sc, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 5:
1st Spire:
Ch 1, sc in first sc, 5 sc in next ch-4 space, (sc, hdc, 3 dc, dcwp, 3 dc) in next ch-6 space, (4 dc, dcwp, 4 dc) in next ch-7 space, (2 dc, dcwp, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, (4 dc, dcw3p, 4 dc) in next ch-7 space, (2 dc, dcw3p, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, (4 dc, dcw3p, 4 dc) in next ch-7 space, (2 dc, dcwp, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, (4 dc, dcwp, 4 dc) in next ch-7 space, (3 dc, dcwp, 3 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, 5 sc in next ch-4 space, skip next sc.
2nd – 5th Spires:
Sc in next sc, 5 sc in next ch-4 space, (sc, hdc, 4 dc) in next ch-6 space, ch 1, slip st in corresponding picot on previous spire, ch 1, slip st in last dc made, 3 dc in same space as last 4 dc, 5 dc in next ch-7 space, ch 4, slip st in corresponding picot on previous spire, ch 1, chwp, ch 1, slip st in 2nd of 4 ch just made, ch 1, slip st in last dc made on current spire, 4 dc in same space as last 5 dc, (2 dc, dcwp, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, (4 dc, dcw3p, 4 dc) in next ch-7 space, (2 dc, dcw3p, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, (4 dc, dcw3p, 4 dc) in next ch-7 space, (2 dc, dcwp, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, (4 dc, dcwp, 4 dc) in next ch-7 space, (3 dc, dcwp, 3 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-6 space, 5 sc in next ch-4 space, skip next sc.
6th Spire:
Sc in next sc, 5 sc in next ch-4 space, (sc, hdc, 4 dc) in next ch-6 space, ch 1, slip st in corresponding picot on previous spire, ch 1, slip st in last dc made, 3 dc in same space as last 4 dc, 5 dc in next ch-7 space, ch 4, slip st in corresponding picot on previous spire, ch 1, chwp, ch 1, slip st in 2nd of 4 ch just made, ch 1, slip st in last dc made on current spire, 4 dc in same space as last 5 dc, (2 dc, dcwp, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, (4 dc, dcw3p, 4 dc) in next ch-7 space, (2 dc, dcw3p, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, (4 dc, dcw3p, 4 dc) in next ch-7 space, (2 dc, dcwp, 2 dc) in next ch-3 space, 5 dc in next ch-7 space, ch 3, chwp, ch 1, slip st in corresponding picot on first spire, ch 2, slip st in 2nd of 7 ch just made, ch 1, slip st in last dc made on current spire, 4 dc in same space as last 5 dc, 4 dc in next ch-6 space, ch 1, slip st in corresponding picot on previous spire, ch 1, slip st in last dc made, (3 dc, hdc, sc) in same space as last 4 dc, 5 sc in next ch-4 space, skip next sc, join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
BASE
Ch 5, slip st in first ch to form ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 sc in ring, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc – 24 sc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc. 
Round 4: Ch 2, (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first sc, ch 2, skip 2 sc, * 2 dc in each of next 2 sc, ch 2, skip 2 sc; repeat from * 4 more times, 2 dc in last sc, join with slip st in first dc – 24 dc.
Round 5: Ch 2, dc in next dc, ch 2, dc in each of next 2 dc, ch 1, * dc in each of next 2 dc, ch 2, dc in each of next 2 dc, ch 1; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 6: Slip st in next dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same space, ch 2, * (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 2; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 7: Slip st in next dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same space, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, * (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 8: Slip st in next dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 1, skip next ch-2 space, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1, skip next ch-2 space, repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 9: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 1, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1, repeat from * to * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 10: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 2, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 2; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 11: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 12: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 3, skip next ch-2 space, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 3, skip next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 13: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 3, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 3; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Rounds 14 and 15: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 4, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 4; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 16: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 2, dc in next ch-4 space, ch 2, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc in next ch-4 space, ch 2; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 17: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 2, dc in next dc, ch 2, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc in next dc, ch 2; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 18: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 2, 2 dc in next dc, ch 2, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 2, 2 dc in next dc, ch 2; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 19: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 2, dc in each of next 2 dc, ch 2, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc in each of next 2 dc, ch 2; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 20: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 1, 2 dc in each of next 2 dc, ch 1, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1, 2 dc in each of next 2 dc, ch 1; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 21: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 1, dc in each of next 4 dc, ch 1, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1, dc in each of next 4 dc, ch 1; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 22: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 1, [dc in each of next 2 dc, ch 1] twice, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1, [dc in each of next 2 dc, ch 1] twice; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 23: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in next ch-1 space, ch 1, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in next ch-1 space, ch 1; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Rounds 24 and 25: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-1 space, ch 1, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-1 space, ch 1; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 26: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-1 space, ch 1, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, (3 dс, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-1 space, ch 1; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first dc.
Round 27: Slip st in each of next 2 dc and in first ch-2 space, ch 2, (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same space, * ch 1, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, join with hdc in first dc.
Round 28: Ch 1, sc in space created by joining hdc, (4 tr, trwp 4 tr) in next ch-2 space, * sc in next ch-1 space, (4 tr, trwp 4 tr) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in all loose ends.
Blocking
Make 2 blocking forms as follows:
Cut out four 6 x 12" (15 x 30.5 cm) pieces, two 8 x 12" (20.5 x 30.5 cm) pieces, and one 12 x 12" (30.5 x 30.5 cm) piece of foam board.
Place 2 of the smaller rectangles side by side with long edges touching, and duct tape them together. This is the inner side of the upper (wedge) part of the form.
On one of the bigger rectangles, mark 1" (2.5 cm) from each corner on each of the short edges. This will leave a 6" (15 cm) center space between the marks at each short edge. Fold wedge piece and align the bottom edges to the marks on the larger rectangle. Using straight pins to keep wedge in place, duct tape outside of top fold of wedge, then duct tape wedge to bottom piece.
Make second form the same way.
Cover both forms and the square piece with self-sticking plastic wrap.
Soak first Motif in fabric stiffener until saturated; only work on piece at a time. Pin Motif flat on the square piece of foam board, pinning out all points and picots. Set aside and allow to dry thoroughly.
Soak next Motif and center it on top fold of wedged piece so the picot joins between spires are aligned along the fold. Pin out all points and picots, making sure Motif ends up the same size as first blocked Motif. Set aside and allow to dry thoroughly.
Work 3rd Motif same as 2nd Motif.
Soak Base in fabric stiffener until saturated, and slide over the plastic-wrapped cone. Stretch it out evenly all around. pin in place. Set aside and allow to dry thoroughly.
When all pieces are dry, gently remove from forms.
Assembly
Lay flat Motif back on plastic covered square piece. Place a line of glue along vertical center line, dabbing picot joins. Line up one folded Motif along vertical center line and press gently together. Prop up the top Motif so it doesn’t move while drying using any household object of a size that would work. Make sure all contact points on both Motifs are touching. Allow to dry thoroughly. Once dry, flip piece upside down, stabilizing and propping to allow you to attach the 2nd folded Motif. Attach 2nd side same way as the first. Once both sides are attached and thoroughly dry, remove Base from its form and set Motifs on top of Base to see where the picots touch the Base. Apply glue to touch points on Base, and set Motifs back on Base. Again prop up the pieces so they don’t move while drying. Make sure all touch points are glued securely. Allow to dry thoroughly.

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m)
Small Version Cream (06003) 1 ball
Large Version Cream (06003) 1 ball
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Beglnkdc = Insert hook down through horizontal bar in center of previous stitch, yoh and pull up a loop. Insert hook into ring, yoh and pull up a loop. Yoh and pull through first 2 loops on hook. Yoh and pull through last 2 loops on hook – Beginning Linked Dc made.

Lnkdc = Insert hook down through the horizontal bar in the center of previous stitch, yoh and pull up a loop. Insert hook in indicated space or stitch and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through first 2 loops on hook. Yoh and pull through rem 2 loops on hook – Linked Dc made.
measurements: Small Version: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] diameter x 5" [12.5 cm] tall. Large Version: Approx 7½" [19 cm] diameter x 8½" [21.5 cm] tall.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Notes: Rnds are worked as a spiral. First lnkdc of each rnd is worked into last lnkdc of previous rnd.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
Set-up rnd: (2 sc. 1 hdc. 1 dc. Place marker in dc. 8 beglnkdc) in ring. 1 lnkdc in each st to marker. 12 sts.
1st rnd: (RS). Beg in last dc from previous rnd, work 2 lnkdc in each st around. 24 lnkdc.
2nd rnd: *1 lnkdc in next lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 36 lnkdc.
3rd rnd: *1 lnkdc in each of next 2 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 48 lnkdc.
4th rnd: *1 lnkdc in each of next 3 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 60 lnkdc.
Large Version only: 5th rnd: *1 lnkdc in each of next 4 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 72 lnkdc.
6th rnd: *1 lnkdc in each of next 5 lnkdc. 2 lnkdc in next lnkdc. Rep from * around. 84 lnkdc.
Both sizes: Next rnd: 1 lnkdc in each lnkdc around.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4 (7)” [10 (18) cm].
Next rnd: 1 lnkdc in each lnkdc to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in next lnkdc. 1 sc in each of next 2 lnkdc. Join with sl st to first st in rnd.
Cuff: Turn work so WS is facing. 1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dc in next st. Place marker in dc. Working in back loops only, 1 lnkdc in each st to marker.
2nd row: 1 lnkdc in each lnkdc around.
Rep 2nd row 1 (3) time(s) more. Next rnd: 1 lnkdc in each lnkdc to last 3 sts. 1 hdc in next lnkdc. 1 sc in each of next 2 lnkdc. Join with sl st to first st in rnd. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Teal (01133)
Contrast A Ecru (00004)
1 ball or 120 yds/109 m
1 ball or 66 yds/60 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
6¾" [17 cm] diameter x 6¾" [17 cm] high plant pot.
measurements: Approx 6¾" [17 cm] diameter x 6½" [16.5 cm] high
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Note: Gauge is important to ensure project matches purchased plant pot size.
instructions:
Note: Pot Cozy and Trim are worked separately and joined during assembly.
POT COZY
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds (unless otherwise stated). Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
With MC, ch 52. Join in rnd with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. 52 sts.
2nd rnd: Skip ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 16 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 55 sts.
5th to 7th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
8th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc) twice. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 58 sts.
9th and 10th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
11th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. 2 sc in next sc. (1 sc in each of next 18 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 61 sts.
12th to 14th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
15th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc) twice. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 64 sts.
16th and 17th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
18th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 20 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 67 sts.
19th to 21st rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
22nd rnd: 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc) twice. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 70 sts.
23rd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
TRIM
With A, ch 72 (or a multiple of 4 that fits evenly around opening of Pot Cozy). Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Ch 3. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc.
2nd rnd: *Skip next 2 sc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Skip next 2 sc. Sl st in sp between 2nd and 3rd sc. Rep from * around, ending with sl st in last sl st from 1st rnd. Fasten off.
Assembly: With RS facing, align foundation edge of Trim evenly around top edge of Pot Cozy. Join A with sl st to any foundation ch of Trim. With Trim on top of Pot Cozy and working through both thicknesses (foundation ch of Trim and front loop only of last rnd of Pot Cozy), work 1 rnd of sl st evenly around. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off. Sl st will form ridge on RS.
Fringe: Cut strands of A 10" [25.5 cm] long. Taking 4 strands, fold in half and Knot into fringe in first ch-3 sp across bottom edge of Trim. Rep for each ch-3 sp across bottom edge of Trim. Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly. Each Fringe has 8 strands. Divide each fringe into 2 groups of 4 strands. Taking group of 4 strands from first fringe and group of 4 strands from next fringe, wrap one strand of A around these 8 strands 4 times 1" [2.5 cm] down from each Fringe Knot so that the wrapped yarn is centered. Fasten securely. Rep for each Knotted Fringe around as shown in photo. Trim Fringe evenly. Un-ply each strand of rem yarn in fringe.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/454 g; 812 yds/742 m)
Contrast A Off White (10514) 1 ball 766 yds/700 m
Contrast B Claret (10562) 1 ball or 192 yds/175 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® yarn needle
6 x ¾" [2 cm] buttons
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 42" [107 cm] diameter. Center opening 8" [20.5 cm] diameter.
instructions:
TREE SKIRT
With A, ch 75.
See diagram on page 3.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 5 ch. *2 dc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 5 ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 84 sts.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 3 (counts as dc throughout). 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in each of last 3 sts. Turn. 96 sts.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc (counts as 2 dc throughout). 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 108 sts.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 8 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 dc in each of last 4 sts. Turn. 120 sts.
5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 132 sts.
6th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 10 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 5 sts. 1 dc in each of last 5 sts. Turn. 144 sts.
7th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 11 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 156 sts.
8th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 12 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 6 sts. 1 dc in each of last 6 sts. Turn. 168 sts.
9th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 13 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 13 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 180 sts.
10th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 14 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 7 sts. 1 dc in each of last 7 sts. Turn. 192 sts.
11th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 15 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 15 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 204 sts.
12th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 16 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 8 sts. 1 dc in each of last 8 sts. Turn. 216 sts.
13th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 17 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 17 dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 228 sts.
14th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 18 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 9 sts. 1 dc in each of last 9 sts. Turn. 240 sts.
Cont as established, inc 12 sts evenly across each row, working 1 more st between incs each row until 24 rows total have been worked. Do not turn or fasten off at end of last row. 384 sts.

Side Slit and interior edging rnd: (RS). Rotate to work along side edge of Tree Skirt. Ch 1. Work sc evenly across side edge to corner at foundation chain. 3 sc in corner. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to next corner. 3 sc in corner. Work sc evenly across side edge to next corner. Fasten off.

SURFACE SLIP STITCH STRIPES
1st Stripe: (RS). Join B with sl st at side edge of Tree Skirt at top of 2nd row. With yarn at WS of Tree Skirt and working across top of 2nd row, sl st in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
2nd to 11th Stripes: Work as for First Stripe, working Surface Sl St Stripes across top of every 2nd row.

SURFACE SL ST Bobble Trim and Button Loop rnd: (RS). Join B with sl st to first st of last row of Tree Skirt (top-right corner of exterior edge). Working around exterior edge: Ch 3. Bobble in first dc. 1 sc in each of next 5 dc. *Bobble in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * to next corner. Bobble in side of first sc at corner. Rotate to work across side and inner edges of work. (1 sc in each sc to next corner. 3 sc in corner) twice. Working across second side edge: 1 sc in each sc across working a button loop beg at first Surface Sl St Stripe and every alt following Surface Sl St Stripe as follows: Ch 5. Sl st in first ch – button loop made (6 button loops in total). Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
Sew 6 buttons along side of Tree Skirt to correspond with button loops.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 376 Burgundy A, 1 skein each 316 Soft White B and 633 Dark Sage C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Tree Skirt measures 42” [107 cm] in diameter.
gauge: Hexagon measures 6” [15 cm] across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Center
Row 1: With right side facing, join B in first ch-2 space of first of 6 hexagons at center of tree skirt; ch 3, work dc2tog over same ch-2 space and next dc, dc in next 11 dc, * work dc3tog over next ch-2 space and seam and next ch-2 space **, dc in next 12 dc; repeat from * to last hexagon, end at **; dc in next 11 dc, dc2tog over next dc and ch-2 space; turn.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 3, skip first st, dc2tog over next 2 dc, * dc in each dc to one dc before next dc3tog **, work dc3tog over next dc and dc3tog and next dc; repeat from * to last 2 sts, end at **; dc2tog over next dc and next dc2tog; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts, * sc in each dc to one st before dc3tog **, work sc3tog over next dc and next dc3tog and next dc; repeat from * to last 2 sts, end at **; sc2tog over next dc and dc2tog; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sts, * sc in each sc to one st before sc3tog **, work sc3tog over next sc and next sc3tog and next sc; repeat from * to last 2 sts, end at **; sc2tog over next sc and sc2tog. Fasten off.
Ruffle
Row 1: With right side facing, join A in the first ch-2 space at the bottom edge of the opening; ch 1, sc in same space, * sc in each st to ch-space before seam, sc in ch-space **, skip seam, sc in next ch-space; repeat from * around, end at **; turn.
Row 2: * Ch 3, skip 1 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around; turn.
Row 3: * Ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; turn.
Row 4: * Ch 5, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first ch-5 space, * (dc, [ch 1, dc] 4 times) all in next ch-5 space, sc in next space; repeat from * around. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
TREE SKIRT
Make 36 hexagons as follows:
With A, ch 5; join with a slip st to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 3, dc2tog in ring (counts as dc3tog), [ch 3, dc3tog in ring] 5 times, ch 3; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Round 2: (Slip st, ch 3, dc2tog, ch 3, dc3tog) all in next ch-3 space, ch 3, [(dc3tog, ch 3, dc3tog, ch 3) all in next ch-3 space] 5 times; join in top of ch-3. Fasten off A.
Round 3: Join C in next ch-3 space; ch 3, dc2tog in same space as joining, ch 3, * (dc3tog, ch 3, dc3tog) all in next ch-3 space, ch 3, ** dc3tog in next ch-3 space, ch 3; repeat from * around, end at **; join. Fasten off C.
Round 4: Join B in next ch-3 space; ch 3, 2 dc in same space as joining, * (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) all in next ch-3 space **, [3 dc in next ch-3 space] twice; repeat from * around, end at **; join. Fasten off.
Sew hexagons together as shown in diagram in next page.
