measurements: Small: To fit plant pot approx 4½" [11.5 cm] in diameter. Large: To fit plant pot approx 6" [15 cm] in diameter.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
Ch 3.
1st rnd:  8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 4 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 5 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 5 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 hdc.
Large Version only: 8th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 6 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 6 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 64 hdc.
Both sizes: Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Rep last rnd 3 (5) times more.
Eyelet rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 (6) hdc. (Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc) twice. Rep from * 3 times more. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc and ch-1 sp around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 56 (64) hdc.
Next 2 rnds:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

materials: Patons Grace (50 g/1.75 oz) 1 ball
Size 3.25 mm (U.S. 3) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
Stuffing.
Crochet thread stiffener.
measurements: Approx height: 8 ins [20.5 cm]
instructions:
Head: Ch 5. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd: 10 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in first sc. 2 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first hdc. 2 sc in next hdc. *1 sc in next hdc. 2 sc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in next sc. *1 hdc in next sc. 2 hdc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 45 hdc. 
5th to 9th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 
10th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. (Yoh. Draw up a loop in next hdc) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - hdc2tog made. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Hdc2tog over next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 36 hdc.
11th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Hdc2tog. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 30 hdc. 
12th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 24 hdc. 
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in next hdc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 hdc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - sc2tog made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
14th and 15th rnds: (Neck). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not fasten off. 
Bodice: 1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 1 dc in first sc. 2 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 72 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 3. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around to last 2 sts. Ch 1. Miss next dc. 1 dc in first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 4. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. 1 dc in first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 4. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 3. Ss in first ch - picot made. 1 sc in same sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. 1 dc in first sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Picot. 1 sc in same sp. Rep from * around ending with ch 2. 1 dc in first sc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 2. 1 dc in first sc. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 7. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * around ending with ch 2. 1 dc in first sc. Fasten off. 
Stuff Head firmly. 
Skirt: Ch 5. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 15 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 16 dc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc. 
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 32 dc. 
6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 40 dc. 
7th rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 19 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 42 dc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 3. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. 1 dc in first sc. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 4. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 1. 1 dc in first sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-4 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 2. 1 dc in first sc.
11th and 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 2. 1 dc in first sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 2. 1 dc in first sc.
14th and 15th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 2. 1 dc in first sc.
16th and 17th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 3. Ss in first ch - picot made. 1 sc in same sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 3. 1 dc in first sc. 
18th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 7. 1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 3. 1 dc in first sc.
19th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 7. 1 sc in next ch-7 sp. Rep from * around, ending with ch 3. 1 dc in first sc. Fasten off.
Halo: With 2 strands of yarn, ch 30. Join with sl st to form a ring. Break one strand of yarn. With rem strand of yarn ch 1 and work 75 dc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Attach to back of head. 
Saturate Bodice, Skirt and Halo in crochet thread stiffener. Stretch and pin Bodice flat to plastic wrap covered surface. Shape Halo with hands. Stretch and pin Skirt on foam cone and remove when dry. 
Glue Bodice to Skirt and fold Bodice to form wings as illustrated.

materials: RED HEART® Crochet Nylon™: 1 tube 53 Teal
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
4 locking stitch markers
6" (15 cm) diameter x 5" (12.5 cm) tall plastic planter
clear nail polish or super glue
four ½" (12mm) wooden beads (optional)
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st;
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Plant hanger measures 6" diameter at base x 6" long (15 x 15 cm), excluding straps. Strap measures 13" (33 cm) long.
gauge: 7 pattern repeats = 4" (10 cm) (one pattern repeat consists of one double crochet and one chain); 7 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Sack
Ch 6; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as first dc, ch 1 here and throughout), (dc, [ch 1, dc] 8 times) in ring, ch 1; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—10 dc and 10 ch-1 spaces.
Round 2: (Slip st, ch 4, dc) in first ch-1 space, [ch 1, dc] twice in each remaining ch-1 space around, ch 1; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—20 dc and 20 ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: (Slip st, ch 4, dc) in first ch-1 space, ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space, [ch 1, dc] twice in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, ch 1; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—30 dc and 30 ch-1 spaces.
Rounds 4–13: Slip st in first ch-1 space, ch 4, dc in next ch-1 space, (ch 1, dc) in each remaining ch-1 space around, ch 1; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch.
Round 14: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in each dc and ch-1 space around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—60 dc.
Round 15: Ch 1, sc in each dc around; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc. Fasten off.
Place marker on 8th, 23rd, 38th and 53rd sts.
Strap (make 2)
Row 1: Leaving a 15" (38 cm) tail, ch 100. Fasten off, leaving a 15" (38 cm) tail.
Row 2: Leaving a 15" (38 cm) tail and working in back bars, join yarn with slip st in first ch, slip st in each ch across. Fasten off, leaving a 15" (38 cm) tail.
FINISHING
Optional: Thread wooden bead through both tails at each end of straps.
Flatten sack and lay on a flat surface with front side facing, matching front and back markers at each end. Beginning at front on right side, tie and securely knot tails at end of strap through marked st. Trim ends and apply nail polish or super glue to cut end to prevent fraying. Repeat to tie other end of strap to matching st at back of piece. Repeat to tie 2nd strap to left side. Weave in ends and apply nail polish or super glue.

rows with RS facing throughout. Do

• Ch 4 at beg of rows counts as 1 dc and
ch-1 sp throughout.
Inner Circle: (See Diagram II on page 3)
With RS facing, join A with sl st to top right 
ch-2 sp corner of Motif 1.
1st row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1 sp). 
*(3 dc in next ch-1 sp – shell made) 7 times. 
Ch 1. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and 
draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in 
corners ch-2 sp. Working across top of next 
Motif: (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and 
draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in 
corners ch-2 sp of next Motif. Yoh and draw 
through all loops on hook – cluster2tog 
made. Ch 1. Rep from * until all Motifs are 
joined (see Assembly Diagram), ending 
last rep with: Ch 1. 1 dc in corner ch-2 sp.
Fasten off. Do not turn. 
2nd row: Join B with sl st to 3rd ch of first 
ch-4 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st.

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m) Black (606004) 1 ball
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
3 plant pots approx 3" [7.5 cm] in diameter.
Dowel approx 24" [61 cm] long.
measurements: To fit plant pots approx 3" [7.5 cm] in diameter. Approx 9" [23 cm] wide.
instructions:
FIRST PLANTER (See diagram on page 2).
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 16 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Ch 4. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 4. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Ch 6. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 6. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 7 times more. Do not fasten off.
Hanging Straps
Beg working in rows as follows:
First Strap: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn.
Rep last row until Strap measures 2" [5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Second and Third Straps: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to next sc of last rnd. Work as given for First Strap.
SECOND PLANTER
Make as given for First Planter, working Hanging Straps to measure 3" [7.5 cm].
THIRD PLANTER
Make as given for First Planter, working Hanging Straps to measure 4" [10 cm].
MOTIFS (make 3)
(See diagram on page 2).
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 5 (counts as 1 dc and ch 2). (3 dc. Ch 2) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-5.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. (1 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in first ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Sew 3 Straps from each Planter to bottom of each Motif with RS of Motif facing inside of Planter.
Dowel Pocket
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to first ch-2 sp at top of Motif of First Planter.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 7 dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Working across top of Motif of Second Planter, 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 7 dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Working across top of Motif of Third Planter, 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 7 dc. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. 27 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until Dowel Pocket measures approx 2" [5 cm], ending on a WS row. Fasten off.
Sew last row to first row at back of work forming pocket.
Insert dowel through Dowel Pocket as seen in picture.
Tassels (make 3)
Wind yarn around a piece of cardboard 5" [12.5 cm] wide 25 times. Tie through loops securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around Tassel 1" [2.5 cm] down from tied end. Fasten securely. Sew one Tassel to bottom of each Planter as seen in picture.

materials: Bernat® Maker Minis™ Kit includes: 10 balls (1.7 oz/50 g each; 17.6 oz/500 g total), (61yds/ 56m each; 610 yds/560 m total)
Contrast A Cream 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Contrast B Brown 1 ball or 10yds/9 m
Contrast C Green 1 ball or 32 yds/39 m
Small amount of Red for embroidery.
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
Polyester fiberfill.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
1 pair of 6 mm Safety Eyes.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop in 4th ch from hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops) twice. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Ch 1. Sl st) all in same ch.
measurements: Approx 4" [10 cm] tall, excluding Hanging Straps.
instructions:
Note: Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. Move marker onto first st at beg of each rnd.
Pot
With A, **ch 2.
See Diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. Work in spiral in continuous rnds.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.**
5th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
6th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
7th to 10th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Do not fasten off at end of 11th rnd. 
Dirt
See Diagram on page 3.
With B, work from ** to ** as for Pot. 
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off.
String of Pearls
See Diagram on page 3.
With C, ch 7 leaving a 3" [7.5 cm] tail. (Yoh and draw up a loop in 4th ch from hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops) twice. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Ch 1. Sl st) all in same ch – Cluster made. 
*Ch 5. (Yoh and draw up a loop in 4th ch from hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops) twice. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook. Ch 1. Sl st in same ch as last sl st - Pearl made.  
Long String (Make 5) Rep from * 6 times more (8 Pearls total). Fasten off.
Short String (Make 4) Rep from * twice more (4 Pearls total). Fasten off.
FINISHING
Attach Strings of Pearls to Dirt by feeding tail ends through sps between 8 sc of 2nd rnd of Dirt, alternating long and short strings.
Thread tail of rem long string through 1st ch and feed through center of Dirt.
Tie ends of tails tog on WS and secure by weaving in ends.
Join dirt to Pot
1st rnd: With sts of Dirt and last rnd of Pot aligned, join by working sl st through back loop of Pot and front loop of Dirt, stuffing Pot before joining with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.
Hanging Straps
Ch 30, leaving tails approx 3" [7.5 cm] at beg and end of ch.
Fasten off.
Using tail ends, attach Straps to each side edge, spaced approx 6 sts apart, making sure eyes and mouth are centered in the front.  
Top Loop
With A, ch 10. 
Bring this chain beneath Straps and join with sl st in 1st ch to enclose Straps and create Top Loop.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197g; 440 yds/402 m) Color of your choice 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Tr2tog = [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.]
measurements: Approx 50" [127 cm] diameter.
instructions:
Notes
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. 
• Ch 4 at beg of row counts as tr.
Ch 114. (See chart on page 3).
1st row:  (WS). (3 dc. Ch 3. 4 dc) in 4th ch from hook – counts as beg shell. *Miss next 9 ch. Ch 3. (4 dc. Ch 3. 4 dc) in next ch – shell made. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 
First Motif: 1st row:  (RS). Sl st in each of first 4 dc and ch-3 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row:  Ch 4. 2 dc in first dc. 1 dc in next dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in last dc. Turn. 
3rd and 4th rows:  Ch 4. 2 dc in first tr. 1 dc in each dc to last tr. (2 dc. 1 tr) in last tr. Turn.
5th row: Sl st in each of first 6 sts. Ch 4. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each dc to last 6 sts. (2 dc. 1 tr) in next dc. Turn. Leave rem 5 sts unworked. 
6th to 8th rows:   As 3rd row 3 times.
9th row: As 5th row.
10th to 12th rows:  As 3rd row 3 times. 
13th row: As 5th row.  
14th to 16th rows:  As 3rd row 3 times. 
17th row: Sl st in each of first 15 sts. Ch 4. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in next dc. Fasten off. Leave rem 14 sts unworked.
Second to Eleventh Motifs: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to ch-3 sp of next shell on left side of previous Motif. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 4. 2 dc in first dc. 1 dc in next dc. (2 dc. 1 tr) in last dc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 4. 2 dc in first tr. 1 dc in each dc to last tr. (2 dc. 1 tr) in last st. Turn.
4th row: Ch 4. 2 dc in first tr. 1 dc in each dc to last tr. (2 dc. 1 tr) in last st. Sl st in top of corresponding ch-4 of previous Motif. Turn.
5th row: Sl st in each of first 6 sts. Ch 4. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each dc to last 6 sts. (2 dc. 1 tr) in next dc. Turn. Leave rem 5 sts unworked. 
6th and 7th rows:  As 3rd row twice. 
8th and 9th rows: As 4th and 5th rows. 
10th and 11th rows:  As 3rd row twice. 
12th and 13th rows:  As 4th and 5th rows. 
14th and 15th rows:  As 3rd row twice. 
16th row: As 4th row. 
17th row: Sl st in each of first 15 sts. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. (1 dc. 1 tr) in next dc. Fasten off. Leave rem 14 sts unworked.
Border: 1st row:  (RS). Join yarn with sl st to first dc of 16th row of Eleventh Motif. Ch 10 (counts as dc and ch 7). Miss next 6 dc. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 7. Miss next 6 dc. 1 sc in first tr of 17th row. Ch 3. Miss next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in last tr of 17th row. Ch 7. Miss next 6 dc of 16th row. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 7. Miss next 7 sts.** 2 dc in next joining sl st. Ch 7. Miss next 7 sts. 1 dc in next dc of 16th row of next Motif. Rep from * 10 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 dc in last dc of 16th row. Turn.  
2nd row:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc. *Ch 3. 3 dc in next ch-7 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in next ch-7 sp.** (Ch 3. 2 dc in next dc) twice. Rep from * 10 times more, then from * to ** once. Ch 3. 2 dc in 3rd ch of ch 10. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 6. 3 dc in next ch-6 sp. Ch 6.** Miss next (3 dc, ch-3 sp, 2 dc). (3 dc. ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * 10 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Turn.  
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 7. Tr2tog. Ch 7.** Miss next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 3. Sl st to top of last dc – picot made. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * 10 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 dc in each of last 2 dc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Suede-ish™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 179 yds/164 m) Main Color (MC) Ocean Waves (91020) 3 balls
Contrast A Turquoise (91009) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 12½" [32 cm] diameter x 13" [33 cm] high.
instructions:
BASKET
Note: Join each rnd with sl st to first st.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
Cont in this manner, inc 8 sc evenly around next 8 rnds (as established). 88 sc.
Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Next rnd: Join MC with sl st to back loop of first sc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each sc around. Join.
Proceed as follows: 1st rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each st around. Join.
Rep last row for pat until Basket when standing measures approx 10" [25.5 cm] tall. Join A. Break MC.
With A, cont in pat until Basket when standing measures approx 13" [33 cm].
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® "Super Saver®" - Traditional: 36 Ounces 311 White CA, 11 ounces 390 Hot Red CB, 5 ounces 368 Paddy Green CC
OR Victorian: 36 Ounces 313 Aran CA, 11 ounces 376 Burgundy CB, 5 ounce 389 Hunter CC
Crochet Hooks: 6mm [US J-10] and 5mm [US Size H-8]
Yarn needle
sewing needle and thread
264 5mm and/or 6mm silver (or gold for Victorian) beads
abbreviations: CA, CB, CC = Color A, Color B, Color C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Tree Skirt measures approximately 60" across. Flower/leaf motif measures approximately 6 1/2" across.
gauge: 12 sts = 4"; 6 rows = 4" in pat with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: SKIRT: With CA, ch 29. Row 1: Dc in 5th ch from hook, * ch 1, dc in next ch; rep from * across; turn. Row 2: Ch 4, skip ch-1 sp, * dc in next dc, 2 dc in next ch-1 sp, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next ch-1 sp; rep from * to last st; d/ in 3rd ch of ch-4; turn – 12 groups of 4 dc. Row 3: Ch 4, skip ch-1 sp, * [dc in next 2 dc, ch 1] twice, skip next ch-1 sp; rep from * to last st; dc in 3rd ch of ch-4; turn. Row 4: Ch 4, skip ch-1 sp, * dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next sp, dc in next 2 dc, ch 1, skip next sp; rep from * to last st; dc in 3rd ch of ch-4; turn – 12 groups of 6 dc. Row 5: Ch 4, skip ch-1 sp, * [dc in next 3 dc, ch 1] twice, skip next sp; rep from * to last st; dc in 3rd ch of ch-4. Row 6: Ch 4, skip sp, * dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in sp, dc in next 3 dc, ch 1, skip sp; rep from * to last st; dc in 3rd ch of ch-4; turn – 12 groups of 8 dc. Continue in the manner of the last 2 rows: adding a ch-1 sp at the center of each of 12 groups on right side rows and working 2 dc in that same sp on wrong side rows, until there are 12 groups of 44 dc on last row. The last (wrong side) row would be worked as follows: Ch 4, skip sp, * dc in next 21 dc, 2 dc in sp, dc in next 21 dc, ch 1, skip sp; rep from * to last st; dc in 3rd ch of ch-4 – 12 groups of 44 dc. Fasten off. Lower Edging-Row 1: With right side facing and larger hook, attach CB in top of last dc; ch 3, dc in next sp, dc in next dc and in each dc across (skip all other ch-1 sps), dc in 3rd ch of ch-4; turn. Row 2: Ch 1, (sc, ch 3, sc) all in first dc, * skip next dc, (sc, ch 3, sc) all in next st; rep from * across. Fasten off. Center Opening Edging: With right side facing and larger hook, attach CB at opening; ch 1, sc evenly up center opening edge, across opposite side of beg ch, and down next edge. Fasten off. Tie: With larger hook and CB, ch 150. Fasten off. Weave through the ch-1 sps of Row 1. Knot each end. Trim. POINSETTIA (Make 12): With smaller hook and CB, ch 4; join with a sl st in first ch to form a ring. Rnd 1: Ch 3, dc in ring, ch 1, [2 dc in ring, ch 1] 6 times; join with a sl st to top of ch-3. Rnd 2: Sl st in next dc, ch 1, sc in next sp, * ch 9, sc in 3rd ch from hook, dc in next ch, tr in next ch, dtr in each of next 2 ch, tr in next ch, dc in next ch **, sc in next sp of Rnd 1; rep from * around, end at **; join with a sl st to first sc – 7 petals. Rnd 3: Ch 1, * skip sc, sc at the base of next 7 sts, (sc, ch 1, sc) all in ch-2 sp at tip of petal, sc in next 7 sts; rep from * around; join. Fasten off. LEAVES (Make 12): With CC, work same as Poinsettia through Rnd 1. Rnd 2: Sl st in next dc, ch 1, sc in next sp, * ch 11, sc in 3rd ch from hook, dc in next ch, tr in next ch, dtr in each of next 2 ch, tr in next ch, dc in next ch, ch 2, skip last 2 ch **, sc in next sp of Rnd 1; rep from * around, end at **; join with a sl st to first sc – 7 leaves. FINISHING: Arrange a poinsettia motif over a leaf motif so that a leaf shows between each of the flower petals and tack together. Sew a group of 22 beads to the center of the poinsettia. Center the assembled motif on one of the 12 sections of the skirt as shown and sew in place.

materials: 3 skeins 1909 Holly Berry A
1 skein each 1621 Evergreen C
1601 Lettuce D
1101 Eggshell E
5 balls 9100 Polar B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 3.75mm [US F-5], 6mm [US J-10], and 16mm [US-Q]
Yarn needle
fabric glue
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Skirt measures 19" (48.5 cm) wide, 48" (122 cm) in diameter, and 132" (335.5 cm) circumference, excluding fur trim.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SKIRT
With medium hook and A, ch 102.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—101 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first st, *dc in next 4 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—122 dc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 4–8: Repeat Row 3.
Row 9: Ch 3, dc in first 5 sts, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 3 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—153 dc.
Rows 10–12: Repeat Row 3.
Row 13: Ch 3, dc in first 2 sts, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 4 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—185 dc.
Rows 14–16: Repeat Row 3.
Row 17: Ch 3, dc in first 4 sts, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 4 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—223 dc.
Rows 18–23: Repeat Row 3.
Row 24: Ch 3, dc in first 2 sts, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 9 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—247 dc.
Rows 25–27: Repeat Row 3.
Row 28: Ch 3, dc in first 6 sts, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 7 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—279 dc.
Rows 29–34: Repeat Row 3.
Row 35: Repeat Row 28—315 dc.
Rows 36–41: Repeat Row 3.
Row 42: Ch 3, dc in next 3 sts, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 9 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * across, turn—347 dc.
Border
Row 1: Ch 1, *working in ends of rows of short edge, sc in each row across; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch; repeat from * to *, turn—183 sc and two 3-sc groups.
Round 2: Ch 1, *sc in each sc around to center st of next 3-sc group, 3 sc in center st; repeat from * once, sc in each sc around to Row 42, ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, *ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * around to last 4 dc, ch 1, skip next st, dc in next 2 dc, skip last dc, ch 3 (counts as last dc); join with slip st in end of first sc—193 sc, 261 dc, and 86 ch-1 spaces. Fasten off.
Row 3: With largest hook and right side of outer edge facing, join B with slip st in top of beginning ch-3, 2 dc in each ch-1 sp across, slip st in top of last ch-3. Fasten off.
TREES
Large Evergreen Tree (make 4)
Middle Section
With medium hook and C, ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—12 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—10 sc.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2.
Rows 5 and 6: Repeat Rows 2 and 3—8 sc.
Rows 7–9: Repeat Rows 4–6—6 sc.
Rows 10 and 11: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off.
Top Section
With medium hook and C, ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch, with wrong side of Row 11 of middle section facing and held behind ch, inserting hook in ch and sts of Row 11, sc in next 6 ch and sts, sc in last 3 ch, turn—12 sc.
Rows 2–10: Work same as Rows 3–11 of middle section—6 sc.
Row 11: Repeat Row 3 of middle section—4 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, turn—2 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, sc2tog—1 sc. Fasten off.
Bottom Section
Row 1: With medium hook and working in opposite side of foundation ch of middle section, join C with sc in 5th ch, sc in next 3 ch; leave remaining ch unworked, turn—4 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in last st—6 sc. Fasten off.
Small Evergreen Tree (make 4)
Bottom Section
With medium hook and C, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—6 sc.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Row 2.
Row 6: Repeat Row 3—4 sc. Fasten off.
Middle Section
With medium hook and C, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, with right side of Row 7 of bottom section facing and held behind ch, inserting hook in ch and sts of Row 7, sc in next 4 ch and sts, sc in last 2 ch, turn—8 sc.
Rows 2–6: Repeat Rows 2–6 of bottom section. Fasten off.
Top Section
With medium hook and C, ch 9.
Rows 1–6: Repeat rows 1–6 of middle section, turn at end of last row. Do not fasten off.
Row 7: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, turn—2 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc2tog—1 sc. Fasten off.
Light Green Tree (make 8)
Bottom Section
With medium hook and D, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—6 sc.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 5–7: Repeat Rows 2–4—4 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, turn—2 sc. Fasten off.
Top Section
With medium hook and D, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch, with right side of Row 8 of bottom section facing and held behind ch, inserting hook in ch and sts of Row 8, sc in next 2 ch and sts, sc in last 3 ch, turn—8 sc.
Rows 2–8: Repeat Rows 2–8 of bottom section, turn at end of last row. Do not fasten off.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc2tog, turn—1 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in sc. Fasten off.
Snowflake (make 8)
With smallest hook and E, ch 8.
Row 1: (Slip st, [ch 3, sl st] 3 times) in 4th ch from hook, slip st in next 4 ch, *ch 7, (slip st, [ch 3, sl st] 3 times) in 4th ch from hook, slip st in first ch of beginning ch-8; repeat from * 5 times. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With smallest hook, weave B-colored ends back and forth between sts and double knot securely in place. Trim ends. With yarn needle, weave in all remaining ends. Referring to photograph for placement, adhere trees and snowflakes to skirt with fabric glue.

materials: RED HEART® Celebration™: 1 ball each of 9840 Blue/Silver A, 9240 Lime/Silver B, and 9340 Aqua/Silver C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9] and 6 mm [US J-10] for Tie
Notions: Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Tree Skirt Measures 38” (96.5 cm) in diameter
gauge: Row 5 = 3½” (9 cm) across; First 5 rows = 3¼” (8.5 cm) from base of Row 1 to shell point in Row 5. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With smaller hook and A, ch 8. 
Row 1: Working in back loops of ch sts, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 6 ch, turn. 
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in next sc, skip next sc, sm shell in next sc, skip next sc, dc in each of last 2 sc, turn. 
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in first dc, dc in next dc, skip next 2 dc, sm shell in next shell space, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc, 2 dc in last dc, turn. 
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in first dc, dc in each of next 2 dc, skip next 2 dc, sm shell in next shell space, skip next 2 dc, dc in each of next 2 dc, 2 dc in last dc, turn. 
Row 5: Ch 3, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 1, skip next 2 dc, sm shell in next shell space, ch 1, skip next 2 dc, dc in each of last 4 dc, turn. 
Row 6: Repeat 5. 
Rows 7-8: Ch 3, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 2, skip next 2 dc, sm shell in next shell space, ch 2, skip next space, dc in each of last 4 dc, turn. 
Rows 9-10: Ch 3, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, med shell in next shell space, ch 3, skip next space, dc in each of last 4 dc, turn. 
Row 11: Ch 3, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, lg shell in next shell space, skip next space, ch 3, dc in each of last 4 dc, turn. 
Row 12: Ch 3, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 3, skip next 3 dc, lg shell in next shell space, skip next ch-3 space, ch 3, dc in each of last 4 dc, turn. 
Row 13: Ch 3, dc in first dc, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 3, lg shell in next shell space, ch 3, skip next space, dc in each of next 3 dc, 2 dc in last dc, turn. 
Row 14: Ch 3, dc in each of next 4 dc, ch 3, skip next 3 dc, lg shell in next shell space, ch 3, skip next space, dc in each of last 5 dc, turn. 
Row 15-16: Ch 3, dc in each of next 4 dc, ch 4, skip next 3 dc, lg shell in next shell space, ch 4, skip next space, dc in each of last 5 dc, turn. 
Row 17: Ch 3, dc in first dc, dc in each of next 4 dc, ch 4, skip next 3 dc, lg shell in next shell space, ch 4, skip next space, dc in each of next 4 dc, 2 dc in last dc, turn. 
Row 18: Ch 3, dc in each of next 5 dc, ch 4, lg shell in next shell space, ch 4, skip next 3 dc, dc in each of last 6 dc, turn. 
Row 19: Ch 3, dc in first dc, dc in each of next 5 dc, ch 4, lg shell in next shell space, ch 4, skip next 3 dc, dc in each of next 5 dc, 2 dc in last dc, turn. 
Row 20: Ch 3, dc in each of next 6 dc, ch 4, skip next 3 dc, lg shell in next shell space, ch 4, skip next space, dc in each of last 7 dc, turn. 
Row 21: Ch 1, sc in first dc, skip next 2 dc, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next dc, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc, skip next dc, lg shell in next shell space, skip next dc, sc in next dc, skip next dc, sm shell in next ch-4 space, sc in next dc, skip next 2 dc, (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next dc, skip next 2 dc, sc in last dc. Do not fasten off. 
PANEL BORDER 
Round 1: Ch 4, sc in top of same st (last dc of Row 20), working up side edge, sc in first row-end dc, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next row-end dc, [ch 1, sc in next row-end dc, ch 1, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next row-end dc] 4 times, [ch 1, sc in next row-end dc, ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next row-end dc] 4 times, ch 1, sc in next row-end dc, ch 1, skip row-end sc of Row 1, working across top edge, (sc, ch 2, sc) in corner ch, ch 3, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch, ch 3, skip 2 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) in last ch, working down other side edge, skip row-end sc of Row 1, [ch 1, sc in next row-end dc, ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next row-end dc] 4 times, [ch 1, sc in next row-end dc, ch 1, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next row-end dc] 5 times, sc in next row-end dc, sc in top of same dc, ch 4, sc in corner sc of Row 21, working across bottom edge, *ch 3, skip next 3 dc, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell space, ch 3, skip next 3 dc, sc in next sc, ch 2, skip next 2 dc, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next shell space, ch 2, skip next 2 dc, sc in next sc; repeat from * once; repeat from * to ** once, join with a slip st in last sc of Row 21. Fasten off A. 
Second and Successive Panels: Make 11 more Panels same as First Panel (through Row 21) and join to previous Panel while working Border as follows: Work Panels in the following color sequence - B, C, A repeat from *, ending with C. 
Tie: With one strand of each color held together as one, and larger hook, leaving a 7” (18 cm) tail, ch 190. Fasten off leaving a 7” (18 cm) tail. FINISHING: With wrong side facing, block tree skirt lightly. Weave Tie over and under ch-3 and ch-2 spaces across top edge. Cut two 14” (35.5 cm) lengths of each color. Holding one length of each color together, draw 3 strands through one end of Tie. Fold in half and tie in an overhand knot with tails. Trim to desired length. Repeat with other 3 strands on other end of tie. Tie in a bow to close up back opening.

materials: RED HEART® Cordial™: 2 balls 9958 Sprout
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm (US K-10½)
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished size: Fits a standard 5” [13 cm] flower pot
gauge: 11 dc = 4” [10 cm]; 6 rows = 4” [10 cm] in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SPECIAL TECHNIQUE
Adjustable ring: Holding the thread a few inches [cms] from the end, wrap around your finger. Do not remove wrap from finger, insert hook into the wrap and draw up a loop of working thread. Chain one to secure the loop and remove ring from finger. Work stitches of first round in the ring. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring

PLANT HANGER
Round 1: Make an adjustable ring, ch 3 (counts as a dc here and throughout), work 11 dc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 to join – 12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st, 2 dc in each dc around, slip st in top of ch-3 – 24 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, slip st in top of ch-3 – 36 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, working in back loops only, dc in each st around, slip st in top of ch-3.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first st, ch 3, skip 2 sts, *sc in next st, ch 3, skip 2 sts; repeat around, slip st in first sc – 12 sc and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 6: *Slip st to first ch-3 space, sc in ch-3 space, *ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc – 12 sc and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Rounds 7-11: Repeat Round 6.
Round 12: Ch 1, 3 sc in each ch-3 space around, slip st in first sc – 36 sc.
Shape Hangers
Last Round: [Ch 100, skip next 8 sts, sc in next st] 4 times. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Hempster™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 190 yds/174 m) White Sand (11013) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Tapestry needle.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.

Trfp2tog = (Yoh) twice. Inserting hook from right to left, draw up a loop around post of next st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. (Yoh) twice. Inserting hook from right to left, draw up a loop around post of next st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Designed to fit a 4” [10 cm] plant pot.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at the beg of rnd counts as dc. 
Do not work into top of any st that a post st is worked around unless specifically instructed. 
All rnds are joined with a sl st to first st. 
Beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here. 
1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join. 12 dc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first st. 2 dc in each rem st around. Join. 24 dc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first st. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in the next st. Rep from * around. Join. 36 dc. 
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first st. *2 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. . 48 dc. 
5th rnd: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in first st. 1 dc in each of next 11 sts. *2 dc in the next st. 1 dc in each of next 11 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 52 dc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * around. Join. 52 sts. 
7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Trfp2tog around last and first post sts of rnd 2 rnds below. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Trfp2tog around last post stitch just worked 2 rnds below and next post st 2 rnds below. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Join. 
9th rnd: As 7th rnd. 
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. Trfp2tog around each of first 2 post sts of rnd 2 rnds below. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Trfp2tog around last post stitch just worked 2 rnds below and next post st 2 rnds below. Rep from * around. Join. 
11th rnd: As 7th rnd. 
12th to 15th rnds: As 8th to 11th rnds. 
16th rnd: Rep 8th rnd. 
17th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dcfp around next post st. *1 dc in each of next 3 sts. 1 dcfp around the next st. Rep from * around. 1 dc in each of last 2 sts. Join. 
18th rnd: *Ch 3. Sl st in next 13 sts. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off. 
Hanging Straps (make 2) 
Work a chain 25” [63.5 cm] long. 
Fasten off.
Assembly
Cross straps, and tie in middle. Sew ends of each Strap to opposite ch-3 sps of 18th rnd using tapestry needle.

pattern_name: Crochet Peppermint Twist Plant Pot Cozy
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Hot Red (0390) 1 ball or 55 yds/50 m
Contrast B White (0311) 1 ball or 51 yds/47 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Yarn needle
measurements: To fit 6" [15 cm] diameter x 6" [15 cm] high plant pot.
instructions:
Notes:
• Base of Pot Cozy is open to allow drainage.
• Carry color not in use loosely across top of rnd and work sts around it.
• Change colors by drawing new color through last 2 loops on hook and proceed with new color, keeping color change to WS of work.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
• Ch 1 at beg of each rnd. Ch 1 does not count as st and is not shown on Chart.
With A, ch 65 (multiple of 5 ch). Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 65 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Proceed as follows for Pat:
Work Chart, noting each square represents 1 sc, reading all rnds from right to left and noting 5-st rep will be worked 13 times.
1st to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last 5 rnds for Pat until work from beg measures approx 5½" [14 cm]. Break B.
Next 2 rnds: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Main Color (MC) Vintage White (10006) 1 ball or 150 yds/137 m
Contrast A Terracotta Rose (10880) 1 ball or 155 yds/140 m
Contrast C Gold (10970) 1 ball or 160 yds/145 m
Contrast E Light Teal (10734) 1 ball or 140 yds/130 m
Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast D Lemon Lime (04223) 1 ball or 220 yds/201 m
Bernat® Blanket Brights™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast B Race Car Red (12001) 1 ball or 150 yds/137 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 29" [73.5 cm] from center round to outer point.
instructions:
Notes:
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Skirt is worked in rnds. It has 5 corners. All rows in Rays worked with RS facing.
Stripe Pat: Work 1 rnd/row of each color in following sequence: MC, A, B, C, D and E.
These 6 rnds/rows form Stripe Pat.
TREE SKIRT
See diagram on page 3.
With MC, ch 50. Join with sl st to first ch to make a ring, taking care not to twist chain.
Foundation rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in same sp as joining sl st. *1 sc in each of next 9 ch. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 sc in each of last 9 ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 sets of ch-2 sps. 11 sc between ch-2 sps.
1st rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. *(Skip next 3 sc. 3 dc in next sc) twice. Skip next 3 sc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 3 times more. Skip next 3 sc. 3 dc in next sc) twice. Skip last 3 sc. 3 dc in first ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Join. Fasten off MC.
2nd rnd: Join A with sl st to any corner ch-5 sp. Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. [*Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc before next ch-2 sp. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 4 times. **Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from ** to last 3 dc. Skip last 3 dc. 3 dc in first ch-2 sp. Ch 2. Join. Fasten off A.
First 2 rnds of Stripe Pat complete. Cont in Stripe Pat, rep last rnd until work from center to any ch-2 sp on last rnd measures approx 20" [51 cm]. Fasten off.
First Ray
Notes:
• Beg each row at beg of previous row, working all rows on RS only.
• Cont working in Stripe Pat throughout.
1st row: (RS). Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, join appropriate color with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc before next ch-2 sp. Skip last 3 dc. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. PM in same ch-2 sp. Fasten off. Do not turn.
**2nd row: (RS). Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, join appropriate color with sl st to first dc. Ch 3. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Skip next 3 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Fasten off. Do not turn.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row until 2 groups of 3-dc rem. 
Next row: (RS). Join appropriate color with sl st to first dc. Ch 3. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip next 3 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Fasten off. Do not turn.
Next row: (RS). Join appropriate color with sl st to first dc. Ch 3. Yoh and draw up a loop in 2nd dc of 3-dc group. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw up a loop in last dc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook. Fasten off.**
Second Ray
1st row: (RS). Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, join appropriate color with sl st to marked ch-2 sp. Ch 3. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between 2 groups of 3-dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc before next ch-2 sp. Skip last 3 dc. 1 dc in next ch-2 sp. Move marker to same ch-2 sp. Fasten off. Do not turn.
Rep from ** to ** as given for First Ray.
Third, Fourth and Fifth Rays: Work as for Second Ray.
Edging: With RS facing, join D with sl st to marked ch-2 sp between Rays. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. *Work 3 hdc around post of each dc up right side of Ray to top of st of last row. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 tr. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in top st of last row. Work 3 hdc around post of each dc down left side of same Ray to ch-2 sp between Rays. 1 hdc in ch-2 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.
Note: Skirt is designed for ease of use with artificial holiday trees. Before final assembly of branches, insert base of trunk through center hole of Skirt, then attach tree stand or base.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Teal (01133) 3 balls or 356 yds/323 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
11½" [29 cm] diameter x 10¼" [26 cm] high plant pot.
Elastic thread.
Sewing needle.
Hot glue gun and glue sticks to secure Cozy to Plant Pot (optional).
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook.
Picot = Ch 4. Sl st in 4th ch from hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scfp = Draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook.
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
measurements: Approx 1 1½" [29 cm] diameter x 8¼" [21 cm] high, excluding fringe.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 19 sts and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Diamond Pat Section. Diamond Pat Motif = 3.5" [9 cm] wide x 32" [81.5 cm] long. Note: Gauge is important to ensure project matches purchased plant pot size.
instructions:
COZY
Note: Cozy is worked in one piece starting with Diamond Pattern Section worked from side to side. Next, Diamond Pattern Section is seamed and Top and Bottom Sections are worked around Top and Bottom edges (see diagram on page 4).
Diamond Pat Section (worked side to side):
Ch 18.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Ch 9. Skip next 9 ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. Ch 2. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sc. Ch 7. Skip next ch-9. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. Ch 3. Skip next ch-2. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 dc. Ch 5. Skip next ch-7. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Skip next ch-2. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. Ch 4. Skip next ch-3. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 dc. Picot. Skip next ch-5. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 dc. Ch 4. Skip next ch-3. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. Ch 4. Skip next ch-4. 1 scfp around each of next 2 dc. Bobble in ch-4 sp created by Picot. 1 scfp around each of next 2 dc. Ch 4. Skip next ch-4. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1hdcbp around next hdc. Ch 3. Skip next ch-4. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sc. Ch 5. Skip next Bobble. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sc. Ch 3. Skip next ch-4. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. Ch 2. Skip next ch-3. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 dc. Ch 7. Skip next ch-5. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 dc. Ch 2. Skip next ch-3. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. Skip next ch-2. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 dc. Ch 9. Skip next ch-7. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 dc. Skip next ch-2. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 scfp around each of next 2 dc. Ch 9. Skip next ch-9. 1 scfp around each of next 2 dc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. Ch 2. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sc. Ch 7. Skip next ch-9. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. Ch 3. Skip next ch-2. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 dc. Ch 2. Working over all 5 ch to enclose them, 1 sc in ch-5 sp 5 rows below. Ch 2. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Skip next ch-2. 1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. Ch 4. Skip next ch-3. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 dc. Picot. Skip next: (Ch 2. 1 sc. Ch 2). 1 dcbp around each of next 2 dc. Ch 4. Skip next ch-3. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep 5th to 12th rows 10 times more, then rep 5th to 8th rows once.
Fasten off.
Seaming: With RS facing each other, fold Diamond Pattern Section in half aligning short ends with each other. Working through both thicknesses and making sure to match pat, sl st evenly across short ends. Fasten off. Turn Diamond Pattern Section RS out.
Join yarn with sl st to 3rd ch of first ch-5 section above seamed edge (ch-5 from 3rd row). Working over all 5 ch to enclose them (working across seam), 1 sc in ch-5 sp 5 rows below to match repeating Diamond Pattern around. Fasten off.
Top Section
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds (unless otherwise stated). Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st at seam to work around Top edge of Diamond Pat Section (see diagram).
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 10 sc evenly around Top edge of Diamond Pat Section working sts around sides of sc sts.
2nd rnd: Skip ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around.
3rd rnd: 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of 109 sc around. 1 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 54 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 54 sc around. 1 sc.
5th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
Bottom Section:
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds (unless otherwise stated). Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st at seam to work around Bottom edge of Diamond Pat Section (see diagram).
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 98 sc evenly around Bottom edge of Diamond Pat Section working sts around sides of sc sts.
2nd rnd: Skip ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 96 sc. 97 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each of next 24 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 46 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. 95 sc.
4th rnd: Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 46 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 45 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 93 sc. Do not fasten off. Cont with Twisted Tabs (see diagram) as follows:
Tabs
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 3 sc. Turn.
2nd to 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. - First Tab made.
Fasten off.
With RS facing, join yarn with sl st in next st along rnd. Rep 1st to 8th rows to create next Tab. Fasten off. Cont working in this manner, working individual 3-st Tabs around. 31 Tabs.
Twist Tabs and begin working in rnds: 1st rnd: With RS facing, twist first Tab so WS of top of Tab is facing and Tab has a single twist in it. Join yarn with sl st in first sc of Tab to work around. Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of next 3 sc. Twist second Tab in same manner as first, being sure to twist in same direction. 1 scbl in each of 3 sc across second Tab. Cont working in this manner, twisting each Tab and working 1 scbl in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 93 sc.
Tabs
Twist Tabs

place
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 29 sc) 3 times. 90 sc.
3rd rnd: Skip ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Surface Crochet:
Top of Twisted Tabs:  With RS facing, join yarn with sl st at first rem loop aligned with seam from 1st row of Twisted Tabs. Ch 1. 1 sc in each rem loop around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Bottom of Twisted Tabs: Work as for Top of Twisted Tabs around 1st rnd at bottom of Twisted Tabs.
Top Hdc Ridge:  With RS facing, join yarn at seam with sl st around first hdc of Top Hdc Ridge of Diamond Pat Section (see chart). Ch 1. Sc evenly around, working sts around hdc sts. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Bottom Hdc Ridge:  Work as for Top Hdc Ridge around Bottom Hdc Ridge of Diamond Pat Section.
Elastic Thread Weaving:  (WS). With sewing needle and elastic thread, weave elastic thread through every other st around 2nd row from Top Edge of Cozy, being sure thread is not visible on RS of work. Tie thread tightly so Cozy fits snuggly around pot. Rep on 3rd and 4th rows from Top Edge of Cozy (3 rows of elastic thread weaving in total).
Optional: To keep Cozy from sliding down slippery pot surface, use hot glue gun and glue sticks to apply small dots of glue to WS around Top Edge of Cozy. Let dry. Fringe: Cut strands of yarn 3½" [9 cm] long. Taking 1 strand, fold in half and knot into fringe in each sc around bottom edge of Cozy. Un-ply each strand of yarn in fringe.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.
